gurmukhi: ieau icq icMq DnuK kr ghXo ]pRB ky sMg jUiJ puin chXo ]phrXo kvc swmuhy DwXo ]sXwm BnY mn kop bFwXo ]1841]
transliteration: Io Chit Chint Dhanoukh Kar Gadyo|| Prabh Ke San Joojh(i) Poun(i) Chadyo|| Pahryo Kavach Saamuhe Dhaayo|| Syaam Bhanai Man Kop Badhaayo||1841||
translation: Thinking thus, he caught hold of his bow in his hand and also thought of fighting with Krishna again; he wore his armour and came in front of Krishna.1841.

gurmukhi: jrwisMD rn BUim mY bwn kmwn cFwie ]sXwm BnY qb kiRSn so bolXo Bauh qnwie ]1842]
transliteration: Jjaraasindh Ran Bhoom(i) Mai Baan Kamaan Chadhaae|| Syaam Bhanai Tab Krishan So Bolyo Bhauh Tanaae||1842||
translation: Jarasandh then taking up his bow and arrows and wearing his crown, said thus to Krishna;1842.
Speech of Jarasandh addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: jo bl hY qum mY nMd nMdn so Ab paurK moih idK`eIXY ]TwFo khw muih Er inhwrq mwrq ho sr Bwj n j`eIXY ]
transliteration: Jo Bal Hai Toum Mai Nand Nandan So Ab Paurakh Mohe Dikhaeeeeyai|| Thaadho Kahaa Muh(i) Or Nihaarat Maarat Ho Sar Bhaaj Na Jaeeeeyai||
translation: “O Krishna ! if you have any power and strength, then show it to me; what are you looking at towards me, standing there? I am going to hit you with my arrow, do not run away anywhere;

gurmukhi: kY Ab fwr hiQXwr gvwr sMBwr kY mo sMg jUJ mc`eIXY ]kwhy kau pRwn qjY rn mY bn mY suK so bC gwie cr`eIXY ]1843]
transliteration: Kai Ab Daar Hathiyaar Gadaar Sanbhaar Kai Ma San Joojh Machaeeyai|| Kaahe Kau Praan Tajai Ran Mai Han Mai Soukh So Bachh Gade Charaeeyai||1843||
translation: “O foolish Yadava ! surrender yourself otherwise fight with me with great caution; why do you want to end your life in the war? Go and graze your cows and calves peacefully in the forest.”1843.

gurmukhi: biRjrwj mnY kib sXwm BnY auh BUp ky bYn suny jb AYsy ]sRI hir ky aur mY irsI Xo pRgtI prsy GiRq pwvk qYsy ]
transliteration: Brijraaj Manai Kabi Syaam Bhanai Uh Bhoop Kai Bain Soune Jab Aise|| Srihar(i) Ke Ur Mai Ris(i) Yo Pragadiparse Ghrit Paavak Taise||
translation: When Krishna heard these words of the king, the anger erupted in his mind like the fire flaming up on putting ghee in it,

gurmukhi: ijau miRgrwj siRgwl kI kUk suny bn hUMk auTy mn vYsy ]jXoN mtkI Air kI bqIXw KtkY pg mY At kMtk jYsy ]1844]
transliteration: Jio Mrigraaj Srigadl Kook Soune Ban Hoonk Outhe Man Vaise|| Jyon Matakiar(i) Bateeyaa Khatkai Pag Mai At Kantak Jaise||1844||
translation: “O like the lion gets infuriated on hearing the howls of jackals, or like the mind getting angry on thorns being struck into the clothes.1844.

gurmukhi: kRu`Dq hÍY biRjrwj ieqY su Gny liK kY iqh bwn clwey ]kop auqy Dnu lyq BXo niRp sXwm BnY doaU nYn qcwey ]
transliteration: Kruddhat Hvai Brijraaj Itai Su Ghane Lakh(i) Kai Tih Baan Dooo Nain Tachaae||
translation: On this side, Krishna getting infuriated, discharged many arrows; on that side the king in anger, with reddened eyes, took up his bow in his hand;

gurmukhi: jo sr Awvq BXo hir aUpir so iCn mY sB kwit igrwey ]sRI hir ky sr BUpiq kY qn kMau qn ko nih Bytn pwey ]1845]
transliteration: Jo Sar Aavat Bhyo Har(i) Oopar(i) Oopar(i) So Chhin Mai Sabh Kaattee Giraae|| Srihar(i) Ke Sar Bhoopat(i) Kai Tan Kaoon Tan Ko Nah(i) Bhetan Paae||1845||
translation: The arrows which were coming towards Krishna were intercepted by him and the arrows of Krishna are not even touching the kng.1845.
